definitions.definition: be or allow or cause to be visible.
examples: wrinkles were starting to show on her face
synonyms: be obvious "the stitches do not show"

definitions.definition: offer, exhibit, or produce (something) for scrutiny or inspection.
examples: an alarm salesperson should show an ID card

definitions.definition: put on display in an exhibition or competition.
examples: he ceased early in his career to show his work

definitions.definition: present (a movie or television program) on a screen for public viewing.
(of a movie) be presented on a screen for public viewing.
examples: a movie showing at the Venice Film Festival

definitions.definition: indicate (a particular time, measurement, etc.).
examples: a travel clock showing the time in different cities

definitions.definition: represent or depict in art.
examples: a postcard showing the Wicklow Mountains

definitions.definition: allow oneself to be seen; appear in public.
examples: he was amazed that she would have the gall to show herself

definitions.definition: arrive or turn up for an appointment or at a gathering.
examples: her date failed to show
synonyms: turn up; informalshow up "they never showed"

definitions.definition: finish third or in the first three in a race.
(of a woman) be visibly pregnant.
examples: Shirley was four months pregnant and just starting to show

definitions.definition: display or allow to be perceived (a quality, emotion, or characteristic).
examples: it was Frank's turn to show his frustration

definitions.definition: accord or treat someone with (a specified quality).
examples: he urged his soldiers to fight them and show no mercy

definitions.definition: (of an emotion) be noticeable.
examples: he tried not to let his relief show

definitions.definition: demonstrate or prove.
examples: experts say this shows the benefit of regular inspections
synonyms: bear out; formalevince "recent events show this to be true"

definitions.definition: prove or demonstrate oneself to be.
examples: she showed herself to be a harsh critic

definitions.definition: cause to understand or be capable of doing something by explanation or demonstration.
examples: he showed the boy how to operate the machine
synonyms: give instructions to "I'll show you how to make a daisy chain"

definitions.definition: conduct or lead.
examples: show them in, please
synonyms: shepherd "a young woman showed them to their seats"

definitions.definition: a spectacle or display of something, typically an impressive one.
examples: spectacular shows of bluebells

definitions.definition: a public entertainment, in particular.
a play or other stage performance, especially a musical.
examples: (theatrical) performance, musical, play, opera, ballet they took in a show

definitions.definition: a program on television or radio.
an event or competition involving the public display or exhibition of animals, plants, or products.
examples: the annual agricultural show

definitions.definition: an undertaking, project, or organization.
examples: I man a desk in a little office. I don't run the show

definitions.definition: an opportunity for doing something; a chance.
examples: I didn't have a show

definitions.definition: an outward appearance or display of a quality or feeling.
examples: Joanie was frightened of any show of affection

definitions.definition: an outward display intended to give a particular, false impression.
examples: Drew made a show of looking around for firewood
synonyms: image More"she's only doing it for show"pretense
parade "Drew made a show of looking busy"

definitions.definition: a discharge of blood and mucus from the vagina at the onset of labor or menstruation.
